original: Bronze sculptures began to emerge in the 7th century AD, primarily in the Chittagong region of Bangladesh. The earliest examples of these sculptures depicted Buddhist themes; however, over time, this artistic tradition was integrated into Hindu art as well. In contemporary times, sculptural art in Bangladesh has been significantly influenced by historical events, particularly the Bangladesh Liberation War. Notable examples of this trend
